name: Hard Shakespeare's Life Quiz / Test | William Shakespeare | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Anne Hathaway.

	Morrow was married to Charles Lindbergh. Rutledge is alleged to have been the girl that Lincoln really loved - but who died young. Boleyn was one of the women in the saga of King Henry VIII.

questions.text: The theatre with which Shakespeare is most closely associated is the:
questions.explanation:
Globe.

	It was situated on the South Bank [of the Thames], in Southwark.

questions.text: Which of the following has NOT been seriously suggested as being the true author of Shakespeare's works?
questions.explanation:
John Webster.

	Bacon may be the name most often mentioned, but there are many who will argue for Oxford or Derby.

questions.text: Another individual is said to be the true author of Shakespeare's works - due in no small part to the timing and the curious circumstances of his death.
questions.explanation:
Christopher Marlowe.

	All were contemporaries of Shakespeare - but it was Marlowe who died young in an altercation that some believe to have been convenient and faked.

questions.text: Which is NOT one of Shakespeare's tragedies?
questions.explanation:
The Duchess of Malfi.

	That one is by John Webster.

questions.text: Which of these plays is NOT by Shakespeare?
questions.explanation:
Every Man in his Humour.

	That one is by Ben Jonson.

questions.text: Which lines are NOT found in Shakespeare?
questions.correct: When you speak of this - and you will - be kind
options: Neither a borrower nor a lender be
questions.explanation:
When you speak of this - and you will - be kind.

	The line is from 'Tea and Sympathy' (by Robert Anderson)

questions.text: Which event did NOT occur during Shakespeare's life?
questions.explanation:
Cromwell's term as Lord Protector.

	Cromwell came some years later. Shakespeare was alive for the Armada (1588) and for the Gunpowder Plot (1605). Elizabeth had a long reign on the throne.

questions.text: Which lines do not belong to Shakespeare?
questions.correct: Come live with me and be my love
options: Tomorrow and tomorrow creeps in its petty pace
Let me not to the marriage of true minds admit impediments
When in disgrace with fortune and men's eyes
questions.explanation:
Come live with me and be my love.

	This is by Marlowe.

questions.text: Shakespeare lived to a ripe old age - for his time. How old was he when he died?
